title: The New York Times - Breaking News, US News, World News and Videos
description: Live news, investigations, opinion, photos and video by the journalists of The New York Times from more than 150 countries around the world. Subscribe for coverage of U.S. and international news, politics, business, technology, science, health, arts, sports and more.
keywords: news, live updates, latest news, breaking news, local news, current events, top stories, livestream, live video, world news, us news

p: Judge Holds Trump in Contempt Over Gag Order and Warns of Potential Jail Time
Donald Trump was fined and warned of jail time after he broke a gag order in his criminal trial. Prosecutors have argued that his statements threaten the trial.
Stormy Daniels’s Lawyer Says He Believed Trump Was Behind Hush-Money Talks
The lawyer testified that the “Access Hollywood” tape increased the urgency of talks to buy and bury Ms. Daniels’s story of a sexual encounter with Donald Trump.
Donald Trump wants to prosecute President Biden. But he is also arguing at the Supreme Court that presidents deserve immunity.
Election updates: In a lengthy interview, Donald Trump left open the possibility of violence after the election.
Amid Campus Clashes, Columbia Says Students Occupying Building Face Expulsion
Columbia and Portland State University closed their campuses after antiwar protesters took over buildings. Over 1,100 have been arrested in recent weeks.
A Bystander to 1960s Protests, Biden Now Becomes a Target
For President Biden, the campus unrest over the war in Gaza recalls peace protests of his youth. But this time, he cannot easily bypass the turmoil.
A House Republican said he was drafting a resolution to censure Rep. Ilhan Omar for suggesting some Jewish students were “pro-genocide.”
Justice Dept. Plans to Recommend Easing Restrictions on Marijuana
The move would kick off a lengthy rule-making process and would amount to a major change in U.S. policy.
How Locals Saved ‘the Yosemite of South America’
A decade-long battle between a wealthy industrialist and a band of activists in Chile led to a surprising $63 million transaction.
Teenager Killed in London Sword Attack, Police Say
A 14-year-old boy was killed and several others were hospitalized in a stabbing spree in northeast London, the police said. A 36-year-old man was arrested.
Honeybees Invaded My House, and No One Would Help
Thirty states have passed laws to protect honeybees. But when they invaded this writer’s house, she learned that they didn’t need saving.
Netanyahu Again Vows to Invade Rafah ‘With or Without’ Cease-Fire Deal
The pledge by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel could undermine efforts to negotiate a cease-fire agreement after seven months of war in Gaza.
A lawsuit in a German court sought to cut off the flow of military aid from Germany to Israel.
Binance Founder Sentenced to 4 Months in Prison
Changpeng Zhao, the founder and former chief executive of the Binance cryptocurrency exchange, had pleaded guilty to a money-laundering violation.
After Ukraine Aid Vote, Republicans Braced for Backlash Find Little
Some Republicans who backed the aid encountered little resistance from voters, who were far more willing to embrace it than right-wing lawmakers.
Democratic Party leaders said their members would join an effort to table any attempt to remove Speaker Mike Johnson.
A Russian airstrike on Monday killed five people and wounded about 30 others in Odesa, Ukrainian officials said.
She Accused a Rowing Legend of Abuse. Now He’s Being Erased From the Sport.
A law firm examining accusations that Ted Nash sexually abused Jennifer Fox — when she was 13 and he was 40 — found that her claims were credible.
Tesla Fires Many on Charger Team, Raising Doubts About Expansion
The carmaker dismissed hundreds of employees in a unit that was critical to its success and seen as important to the future of electric vehicle sales.
A Mysterious Flier, a Tiny Charity and a Disinformation Campaign at the Border
A flier urging migrants to vote for President Biden rocketed around right-wing social media. But was it authentic?
The Exit Interviews: 12 Departing Lawmakers Tell Us What Congress Is Really Like
The Price We Pay for Having Upper-Class Legislators
That Strange Piece of Metal Origami Embodies All of Elon Musk’s Flaws
Saying Goodbye to My Brilliant Friend, the Poetry Critic Helen Vendler
Are Bonds Gonna Party Like It’s 1999?
Cows Are Just an Environmental Disaster
I Was an Attorney at the D.A.’s Office. This Is What the Trump Case Is Really About.
This Isn’t the China I Remember
Some Concrete Reasons Not to Be Totally Panicked
Class of 2024, It’s Not in Your Head: The Job Market Is Tough
When It Comes to TikTok, the World’s Democracies Have Played the Sucker for Far Too Long
Here’s why more Latino voters find Donald Trump appealing.
Amazon Reports $143.3 Billion in Revenue for First Quarter of 2024
The company also reported that profit more than tripled, to $10.4 billion, topping Wall Street expectations.
New York Woman Gets 18 Years for Funding Terrorism With Cryptocurrency
Prosecutors said Victoria Jacobs sent funds to Bitcoin wallets controlled by a terrorist training group that operated in Syria.
Jeff Zucker Abandons Telegraph Bid, Putting London Paper Back Into Play
RedBird IMI said it had withdrawn its attempt to acquire the storied newspaper after a revolt from Conservative Party leaders.
‘Hell’s Kitchen’ and ‘Stereophonic’ Tie for Most Tony Nominations
The Alicia Keys semi-autobiographical musical and David Adjmi’s behind-the-music play each picked up 13 nominations.
In Reversal, U.S. Expert Panel Recommends Breast Cancer Screening at 40
Ex-N.S.A. Employee Who Tried to Sell U.S. Secrets to Russia Gets 22 Years
9 Rescued in Atlantic After Days on Wreckage of Migrant Boat
Werner Spitz, Forensic Expert in High-Profile Murders, Dies at 97
A 2-Year-Old Died When a Bounce House Blew Away. Can They Be Made Safer?
Supreme Court Allows, for Now, Texas Law Restricting Access to Porn
The House That Once Embarrassed Them Is Now a Showplace
A couple’s disdain for their house “was a green light to give it a whole new life,” a designer said.
